articles.author: Asjad Ahmed Khan
articles.description:
Automation Isn‚Äôt Enough Anymore


For decades, business automation has been a reliable tool for improving efficiency, moving emails, copying data, and sending alerts.
But today‚Äôs business environment is faster, more data-driven, and increasingly unpredictable. Traditional rule-based automation is struggling to keep up.
Traditional automation tools like Zapier, Make, and basic RPA (Robotic Process Automation) platforms helped companies automate repetitive tasks. These systems operate on "if-this-then-that" logic.
However, they have significant limitations:
Lack of Adaptability: Even small deviations, like a changed email format, can cause failures.
No Contextual Understanding: They cannot interpret unstructured data, sentiment, or nuance.
Constant Maintenance: Business process changes requi‚Ä¶
articles.title: Why AI Workflows Are the Future of Business Automation

articles.author: Kostiantyn Ostapenko
articles.description:
Hi! I‚Äôm Kostiantyn, a 14-year-old fullstack developer with solid skills in JavaScript and TypeScript. Over the last few months, I‚Äôve earned more than $3,000 working on real projects and freelancing ‚Äî all before even finishing high school.
Mastering JavaScript/TypeScript and Next.js for fast, scalable frontend and backend development.

Building simple SaaS projects that solve real problems and bring real income.

Learning backend basics with Node.js and NestJS, since this stack is in huge demand.







  
  
  Why I Put Go on Hold


I started learning Go because it‚Äôs popular for backend and microservices. But quickly realized it doesn‚Äôt fit my current goals. Go requires more time to master and lacks the quick feedback loop I get with JavaScript and Node.js. For now, I prioritize skills and tools that help me earn money faster and build complete products.
To keep building SaaS products and freelance projects that improve my skills and generate income. Practical experience and fast results are key at my age.
I‚Äôll continue focusing on JavaScript, Next.js, and NestJS, then later consider other backend languages like Go or Rust when I‚Äôm ready for bigger challenges.
Thanks for reading! Feel free to follow my journey and share your own experiences. Let‚Äôs grow together.
Check out my SaaS project: https://charm-ai.io
articles.title: How I‚Äôm Earning $3,000 at 14 While Learning to Build SaaS Products

articles.author: JavaFullStackDev.in
articles.description:
Oh, look‚ÄîJava decided to join the AI party! And no, it‚Äôs not just another half-baked wrapper around TensorFlow that makes you question your life choices. Meet Brain4j, a supposedly functional, open-source machine learning framework for Java developers who refuse to switch to Python like sensible people.  
Hold Up‚ÄîJava Can Do AI Now?


Yes, apparently. While the rest of the world was busy worshipping at the altar of Python and PyTorch, some brave (or stubborn) souls decided: "Hey, what if we made AI in Java without summoning Cthulhu?" And thus, Brain4j was born.  
"Features" (Because Every Framework Needs a Sales Pitch)




Neural Networks That Don‚Äôt Require a PhD  
Feedforward nets? Check.

CNNs and RNNs? Sure, why not.

Actual documentation? Let‚Äôs not get carried away.




Classic ML Algo‚Ä¶
articles.title: Brain4j: Wait, Java Finally Has a Brain?

articles.author: Python Tutorial
articles.description:
C# Tutorial



Introduction


When learning to code with C#, beginners often focus on syntax, loops, and object-oriented concepts. But as you progress, understanding how your code performs and how memory is managed becomes essential. This article is part of our C# Tutorial series and is intended for those advancing from the basics covered in C# Programming for Beginners. We'll explore practical performance tips and demystify memory management in C# to help you write faster, more efficient applications.
In C# applications, particularly those operating on large datasets or in real-time environments, inefficient code can result in high memory usage, slow execution, and even application crashes. Whether you're building desktop apps, web APIs, or games, improving performance and managing memory‚Ä¶
articles.title: C# Performance Tips and Memory Management

articles.description:
Enabling HTTP/2 on IIS (Internet Information Services) is a straightforward process that involves a series of steps to install, configure, and secure your web server.
By following these six steps, you can ensure that your server is ready to take advantage of the enhanced performance and efficiency provided by the HTTP/2 protocol.
1. Install Internet Information Services
Getting it on Windows 10, click on the Start button, go to the Control Panel and choose Programs and Features; click "Turn Windows Features On or Off."
In the list, tick the requirements which include selecting Internet Information Services to enable IIS.
Now, if you are working with Windows Server 2016, it's easier for you to find this option in 'Server Manager' >> Add Roles and Features >> Web Server (IIS) in the list of ‚Ä¶

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
Blockchain gaming user activity dipped and funding slowed in April, but the overall ecosystem is healthier and maturing, according to blockchain analytics platform DappRadar.
User activity dropped 10% over April, with blockchain gaming reaching a 2025 low of 4.8 million daily Unique Active Wallets, DappRadar analyst Sara Gherghelas said in the platform‚Äôs April Games Report.
Gaming dominance over the decentralized app industry also fell and is now tied with decentralized finance at 21%.¬†
Gherghelas said it‚Äôs clear user attention is shifting away from gaming, but under the surface, new infrastructure went live, major publishers doubled down, and high-quality games edged closer to launch.
Source: DappRadar
‚ÄúThe blockchain gaming industry isn‚Äôt dead ‚Äî it‚Äôs evolving. It‚Äôs moving from noise to s‚Ä¶
articles.title: Crypto gaming interest drops in April, overall ecosystem healthier: DappRadar

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Ethereum layer-2 scaling platform Starknet has reached a decentralization milestone laid out by Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin and is now the largest zero-knowledge rollup-based network by total value locked.
Starknet said in a press release shared with Cointelegraph that it has hit ‚ÄúStage 1‚Äù decentralization, according to a framework Buterin laid out in 2022, which means the network operates with limited oversight or ‚Äútraining wheels.‚Äù
Starknet added that the framework was the ‚Äúgold standard onchain tool for analyzing Ethereum scaling solutions,‚Äù and said it achieved the milestone through changes such as creating a security council and censorship-avoidance mechanisms.¬†
While the system still allows intervention from a security council, it has implemented a fully functional validity p‚Ä¶
articles.title: Starknet hits ‚ÄòStage 1‚Äô decentralization, tops ZK-rollups for value locked

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Jesse Coghlan
articles.description:
The Pacific US territory of the Northern Mariana Islands has passed a bill allowing its small constituent island of Tinian to launch a stablecoin, overriding an earlier veto by the territory‚Äôs governor.
The 20-member Northern Mariana Islands House voted 14-2 to undo Governor Arnold Palacios‚Äô April 11 veto of the bill, which allows the Tinian local government to issue licenses to internet casinos and includes a provision for the Tinian treasurer to issue, manage and redeem a ‚ÄúTinian Stable Token.‚Äù¬†
The territory‚Äôs nine-member Senate had revived the bill on May 9, voting 7-1 in a two-thirds majority to override the veto, which then needed a two-thirds majority in the House to pass.
Representative Marissa Flores (top left) had urged for ‚Äúthoughtful deliberation‚Äù on the internet gaming and sta‚Ä¶
articles.title: Stablecoin bill passes in Northern Marianas as House overrides veto

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
Jason Guthrie, head of product at asset manager WisdomTree, says he‚Äôs optimistic despite a noticeable lack of hype that typically comes along with a crypto bull run.¬†
There hasn't been a ‚Äúreally frothy use case that has typically driven these market cycles previously,‚Äù such as initial coin offerings (ICOs), non-fungible tokens (NFTs), or DeFi lending, Guthrie told Cointelegraph at Consensus. 
‚ÄúThis time, we‚Äôve continued to see the asset class gathering value, we‚Äôve continued to see the companies that are built on this technology, growing revenue, growing client bases, continuing to innovate without really hanging their hat on one of these frankly less than useful use cases,‚Äù he said.
WisdomTree founder Jonathan Steinberg (left), Jason Guthrie, head of product (middle) and head of digital a‚Ä¶
articles.title: Crypto‚Äôs lack of ‚Äòfrothy use case‚Äô a good sign: WisdomTree exec

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
Another 12 people have been charged for their involvement in a $263 million crypto crime spree that stole 4,100 Bitcoin from a Genesis creditor last August, along with a string of break-ins and money laundering.¬†
The 12 new names, included in a superseding indictment, add to charges originally brought against the main defendant in the case, Malone Lam, on Sept. 19, 2024, the Department of Justice noted in a May 15 statement.
Jeandiel Serrano was named a defendant in the initial indictment but was not included in the superseding one. 
The DOJ said several defendants have been arrested, while two others are believed to be living in Dubai.
Many of the suspects, with aliases like ‚ÄúGoth Ferrrari‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe Accountant,‚Äù come from California, mostly aged between 18 and 22.¬†
The group allegedly beg‚Ä¶
articles.title: DOJ charges 12 more gamer-turned $263M Bitcoin robbers

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Elon Musk‚Äôs artificial intelligence firm xAI has blamed an ‚Äúunauthorized modification‚Äù to the Grok chatbot‚Äôs response, causing it to generate responses mentioning political and racial tensions in South Africa.¬†
On May 16, xAI provided an update on the Grok AI chatbot‚Äôs inflammatory responses, stating that on May 14, ‚Äúan unauthorized modification was made to the Grok response bot‚Äôs prompt on X.‚Äù
‚ÄúThis change, which directed Grok to provide a specific response on a political topic, violated xAI‚Äôs internal policies and core values,‚Äù it added.
The firm stated that it had conducted a thorough investigation and is implementing measures to enhance the AI chatbot‚Äôs transparency and reliability.
Grok generated responses on May 14, mentioning a ‚Äúwhite genocide‚Äù conspiracy theory in South Africa when‚Ä¶
articles.title: Grok 'white genocide' rant due to unauthorized prompt change: xAI

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Coinbase stock dipped after news broke of a cyberattack that exposed customer data and an ongoing Securities and Exchange Commission investigation over misstated user numbers in 2021.
The double whammy of bad news rattled investors as company stock (COIN) slid 7% in a fall to $244 in after-hours trading on May 15, according to Google Finance.¬†¬†
Coinbase stock 24 hours. Source: Google Finance¬†
Coinbase has since confirmed the report from The New York Times, which stated the SEC has been investigating whether Coinbase misstated its user numbers in past disclosures, an inquiry that began during the Biden administration and has continued under the Trump administration.
‚ÄúThis is a hold-over investigation from the prior administration about a metric we stopped reporting two and a half years ago,‚Ä¶
articles.title: Coinbase drops 7% on customer breach, SEC probe into user numbers

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
M√©liuz‚Äôs executive chairman says his fintech firm has become Brazil‚Äôs first publicly-traded Bitcoin treasury company following shareholder approval, with the firm also announcing it bought $28.4 million worth of Bitcoin to add to its existing stack.
‚ÄúHistoric day! Our shareholders have approved, by a wide majority, the transformation of M√©liuz into the first Bitcoin Treasury Company listed in Brazil,‚Äù Israel Salmen posted to X on May 15.
Salmen said the firm snapped up 274.52 Bitcoin (BTC) for an average purchase price of $103,604, achieving a BTC yield of 600%.¬†
M√©liuz now holds 320.3 Bitcoin, worth a little over $33 million, with the latest purchase adding to the Brazilian fintech firm‚Äôs first purchase of 45.73 Bitcoin on March 6.
Details of M√©liuz‚Äôs latest Bitcoin purchase. Source: Isra‚Ä¶
articles.title: Brazil fintech gets approval to become a Bitcoin treasury company

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
Deepfake-assisted hackers are now targeting US federal and state officials by masquerading as senior US officials in the latest brazen phishing campaign to steal sensitive data.¬†
The bad actors have been operating since April, using deepfake voice messages and text messages to masquerade as senior government officials and establish rapport with victims, the FBI said in a May 15 warning.¬†
‚ÄúIf you receive a message claiming to be from a senior US official, do not assume it is authentic,‚Äù the agency said.¬†¬†
If US officials‚Äô accounts are compromised, the scam could become far worse because hackers can then ‚Äútarget other government officials, or their associates and contacts, by using the trusted contact information they obtain,‚Äù the FBI said.¬†
As part of these scams, the FBI says the hackers a‚Ä¶
articles.title: AI scammers are now impersonating US government bigwigs, says FBI

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Jesse Coghlan
articles.description:
US federal prosecutors are pressing ahead with their case against Tornado Cash founder Roman Storm, but will drop a small part of their indictment after the Department of Justice rolled back its crypto enforcement last month.
Jay Clayton, the acting US Attorney for Manhattan, told federal court judge Katherine Polk Failla in a May 15 letter that the charges against Storm still stand, bar one part of a conspiracy to operate an unlicensed money transmitting business charge.
‚ÄúAfter review of this case, this Office and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General have determined that this prosecution is consistent with the letter and spirit of the April 7, 2025 Memorandum from the Deputy Attorney General,‚Äù Clayton wrote.
Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche‚Äôs April memo said the Justice Departmen‚Ä¶
articles.title: Tornado Cash dev Roman Storm trial goes ahead with slight trim

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
The State of Wisconsin Investment Board (SWIB), which oversees the state‚Äôs retirement funds, unloaded its shares in BlackRock‚Äôs iShares Bitcoin Trust ETF (IBIT) during the first quarter, filings show.
The Wisconsin Investment Board reported no spot Bitcoin ETF positions in its 13F filing to the US Securities and Exchange Commission on May 15, liquidating all 6,060,351 IBIT shares it reported holding from the previous quarter.¬†
The more than 6 million IBIT shares are worth around $355.6 million at current prices.
SWIB was one of the first state investment funds to provide Bitcoin exposure to US retirees when it bought $164 million worth of Bitcoin ETFs in Q1 2024 ‚Äî the same quarter the Bitcoin products launched.
Source: Julian Fahrer
The mass sell-off comes only a quarter after SWIB reporte‚Ä¶
articles.title: Wisconsin Investment Board sold off its Bitcoin ETF stash

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Alex O‚ÄôDonnell
articles.description:
Global foreign exchange and payments platforms are lobbying hard against stablecoins, which stand to significantly disrupt their business models, investor Kevin O‚ÄôLeary said during a keynote address at Consensus 2025. 
Legacy forex and payments platforms often extract large fees for servicing cross-border cash transfers and stand to lose out on revenue if regulated stablecoins become accepted as a cheaper, faster alternative, O‚ÄôLeary said at the Toronto conference.¬†
‚ÄúCurrency trading is a multi-trillion dollar market ‚Äî and it‚Äôs old and ugly and inefficient,‚Äù O‚ÄôLeary said, adding that ‚Äú[ t]he biggest threat to that monopoly or oligopoly is a regulated stablecoin.‚Äù¬†
‚ÄúOnce that‚Äôs approved, the multi-trillion dollar FX market becomes efficient, transparent, and inexpensive,‚Äù he said.¬†
Kevin O‚Äô‚Ä¶
articles.title: Legacy forex, payments platforms ‚Äòhate‚Äô stablecoin adoption ‚Äî Kevin O‚ÄôLeary

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
Coinbase chief legal officer Paul Grewal addressed some of the concerns raised by US lawmakers and industry leaders around President Donald Trump‚Äôs crypto ventures, and how they may affect related legislation.
Speaking at the Consensus conference in Toronto on May 15, Grewal said there had been ‚Äúhiccups‚Äù in Congress since the Senate Banking Committee voted to advance the Guiding and Establishing National Innovation for US Stablecoins, or GENIUS Act, in March. 
Though Grewal said there were disputes over ‚Äúsubstantial issues that need to be addressed‚Äù in the bill, he hinted that Trump‚Äôs involvement in the industry was a ‚Äúcomplicating factor.‚Äù¬†
‚ÄúThe discussion around the president's support for a certain memecoin or two and other efforts does add a certain level of challenge to the effort to ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Trump‚Äôs crypto ties ‚Äòadd a certain level of challenge‚Äô to passing bills ‚Äî Coinbase exec

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Cointelegraph
articles.description:
Today in crypto, the US Department of Justice added another 12 people to their list of defendants suspected of being involved in a major US crypto racketeering ring. Coinbase reportedly refused to pay a $20 million ransom after insiders leaked user data in a phishing scheme, and the company has since fired the group of contracted customer support agents allegedly involved in the attacks. 
DOJ charges 12 more gamer-turned $263M Bitcoin robbers
Another 12 people have been charged for their involvement in a $263 million crypto crime spree that stole 4,100 Bitcoin from a Genesis creditor last August, along with a string of break-ins and money laundering.¬†
The 12 new names, included in a superseding indictment, add to charges originally brought against the main defendant in the case, Malone Lam‚Ä¶
articles.title: Here‚Äôs what happened in crypto today

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
There is an ongoing race across the world for Bitcoin accumulation, according to Eric Trump, the second-eldest son of US President Donald Trump. Speaking at a crypto conference in Toronto on May 15, Trump said that from families to government funds, ‚Äúeverybody in the world is trying to hoard Bitcoin right now.‚Äù 
The remarks came during a panel at Consensus 2025. Sharing the stage with Asher Genoot, the CEO of Bitcoin (BTC) mining company Hut 8, Trump said Bitcoin adoption has been incredible.
‚ÄúI'm traveling. I'm on a plane. Everybody in the world is trying to hoard Bitcoin right now. Everybody. I hear it from sovereign wealth funds. I hear it from the wealthiest families. I hear from the biggest companies.‚Äù
Asher Genoot and Eric Trump at Consensus 2025. Source: Cointelegraph
Trump describe‚Ä¶
articles.title: ‚ÄòThe world is trying to hoard Bitcoin right now‚Äô ‚Äî Eric Trump

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Marcel Pechman
articles.description:
Key takeaway:

Bitcoin‚Äôs struggles to overtake the $105,000 level as US macroeconomic headwinds remain a challenge.  

Steady inflows from institutional investors and the strength of the $100,000 support point to growing confidence in Bitcoin.

Bitcoin (BTC) has struggled to break above $105,000 since May 10, leading traders to question whether the bullish momentum has faded. Although BTC managed to reclaim the $104,000 level, demand for leveraged long positions has dropped sharply, as indicated by the decline in the Bitcoin futures premium.
¬†
Bitcoin 2-month futures annualized premium. Source: laevitas.ch
On May 14, the annualized Bitcoin futures premium peaked at 7%, but then fell to 5%, which is near the neutral-to-bearish threshold and matches the level seen four weeks ago when BTC tra‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin traders‚Äô evolving view of BTC‚Äôs role in every portfolio bolsters $100K support

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vince Quill
articles.description:
Asset tokenization is set to accelerate the movement of capital across traditional markets, according to Chainlink co-founder Sergey Nazarov. Speaking with Cointelegraph at Consensus 2025 in Toronto, Nazarov said the shift will boost capital velocity in asset classes such as treasuries, equities, private credit, commercial debt, and real estate.
"I think that there are two sides to this equation. One is the asset, and the other one is the payment. So, you need more high-quality assets onchain, but you also need more frictionless payments that existing institutions can use easily," Nazarov said on May 14. 
The remarks came on the same day Chainlink announced a partnership with Kinexys, a blockchain network for institutional-grade tokenized assets by JP Morgan, and digital asset firm Ondo Fi‚Ä¶
articles.title: Asset tokenization expected to speed capital flows, says Chainlink's Nazarov

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Alex O‚ÄôDonnell
articles.description:
Bitdeer Technologies Group reported a 41% year-over-year drop in revenue to $70.1 million for the first quarter of 2025, the Bitcoin miner said on May 15.¬†
The Singaporean company clocked an operating loss of $3.2 million for the quarter, down from a $34.1 million profit during the same period last year, its earnings release said.¬†
However, Bitdeer reported a Q1 net income of more than $400 million, largely driven by gains on convertible notes and warrants issued to stablecoin issuer Tether in 2024.
Bitdeer‚Äôs revenue declines come as miners increasingly expand beyond Bitcoin (BTC) mining and pivot toward supplying high-performance computing (HPC) for artificial intelligence applications.¬†
‚ÄúAs we scale self-mining and execute on our ASIC [mining hardware] roadmap, we are also advancing plan‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitdeer Q1 revenue falls more than 40% year-over-year

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
More than two-and-a-half years after filing for bankruptcy, cryptocurrency exchange FTX is moving forward with repaying users who have not had access to their funds.
In a May 15 notice, the FTX Recovery Trust announced that it would begin disbursing funds to the second group of parties eligible under the exchange‚Äôs reorganization plan. Starting on May 30, FTX will send more than $5 billion to creditors ‚Äúwithin 1 to 3 business days‚Äù through crypto firms BitGo and Kraken.¬†
In accordance with the reorganization plan, FTX said five groups of ‚Äúconvenience classes‚Äù would receive between 54% and 120% distribution of assets. The repayment schedule for the next class of creditors will be ‚Äúannounced in due course,‚Äù and the debtors were expected to pay up to $16 billion if all claims were filed.
Brea‚Ä¶
articles.title: FTX estate to start distributing more than $5B on May 30

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
Stablecoin regulation is ‚Äúthe next catalyst‚Äù for the crypto industry and could lead to unprecedented ‚Äúappetite from institutional investors,‚Äù according to Ash Pampati, head of ecosystem at the Aptos Foundation.
In an interview with Cointelegraph at Consensus 2025 in Toronto, Pampati said that ‚Äúthe whole world outside of the United States [‚Ä¶] has already jumped onto this [stablecoins],‚Äù adding that ‚Äúthe US is [...] at the doorstep.‚Äù 
‚ÄúI really think about new use cases that can emerge because of the borderless nature of stablecoins, because of the efficiency of the dollar onchain,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIf you're trying to send money to your friend in Nigeria, why do you have to go through a bunch of hoops?‚Äù
Stablecoins are often used to transfer money across borders, as they are easier and cheaper to ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Stablecoin regulation next ‚Äòcatalyst‚Äô for crypto industry ‚Äî Aptos head

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Biraajmaan Tamuly
articles.description:
Key Takeaways:

Solana formed a megaphone chart pattern with a potential $210 price target. 

Solana‚Äôs ecosystem growth highlights renewed investor interest with a $4 billion realized cap increase and 731 million transactions.

Solana (SOL) price tested its key resistance at $180 earlier this week, but the altcoin failed to establish a position above the level. Over the past few days, SOL has consolidated above the $170 mark, but prices have dropped 5.65% since May 14.
Including the recent minor dip, Solana has formed a megaphone pattern on the 4-hour chart, a classic technical setup indicating increasing volatility. 
Solana 4-hour chart. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView
The chart illustrates that the megaphone‚Äôs upper resistance trendline sits near $185, aligning with immediate resistanc‚Ä¶
articles.title: Solana network activity surge and ‚Äòmegaphone‚Äô chart pattern set $210 SOL price target

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Nancy Lubale
articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Bitcoin's 36% rebound from $74,500 runs into resistance at $106,000.

Bid-side liquidity is staking up on the downside near $93,000.

Bitcoin (BTC) price has rebounded by 36% from its April 9, five-month low at $74,500. However, its failure to decisively break above $106,000 has sparked concerns about whether a sharp correction is possible in the coming days.
BTC/USD daily price chart. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView
Over 97% of Bitcoin‚Äôs holders are now in profit
Bitcoin‚Äôs recent break above $105,000 saw its price rise above the short-term holder realized price as this cohort of traders flipped some of their unrealized losses into profit.¬†
Data from CryptoQuant reveals that less than 2.8% of Bitcoin investors were still in a position of loss when the price hovered around‚Ä¶
articles.title: Is Bitcoin price going to crash again?

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Aaron Wood
articles.description:
The slow adoption of stablecoins in Canada has some local crypto industry observers concerned that the country is falling behind.
The Canadian Securities Administrators (CSA) classified stablecoins as ‚Äúsecurities and/or derivatives‚Äù in December 2022 after the FTX debacle that shook markets and turned many lawmakers against the crypto industry.
Regulating stablecoins as a security has seen few local stablecoin issuers arise, but in the United States and the European Union, softening regulations have seen significant growth in the stablecoin market. This makes Canada, observers say, less competitive with other jurisdictions.¬†
Of particular concern is the perceived gap in peer-to-peer (P2P) payments in Canada, which stablecoins are uniquely qualified to fill.¬†
Stablecoins globally have grown ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Canada lags with stablecoin approach, but there‚Äôs room to catch up

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
Coinbase has reportedly fired a group of customer support agents following their alleged involvement in social engineering attacks on users. The contracted agents were based in India. 
According to a May 15 Fortune interview, Coinbase's chief security officer, Philip Martin, said the company flagged customer support contractors who allowed scammers access to user data, suggesting they could be Indian nationals. 
The CSO‚Äôs comments came after some crypto users reeled from attempted phishing attacks using their Coinbase data, which the exchange estimated could cost them between $180 million and $400 million in remediation and reimbursement.

Qiao Wang, a core contributor to Alliance DAO, said in a May 15 X post that he may have been a victim of one of these attacks. He said a scammer notifie‚Ä¶
articles.title: Coinbase fires compromised agents in India ‚Äî Report

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Biraajmaan Tamuly
articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Spot Bitcoin ETF inflows dropped over 90% from $3 billion to $228 million in four weeks. 

While strong ETF inflows often drive Bitcoin rallies, recent data shows price movements can occur independently.

Despite short-term selling pressure, long-term BTC whale buying suggests a potential continuation of the BTC uptrend.

The Bitcoin (BTC) market posted a 90+% drop in spot BTC exchange-traded fund (ETF) inflows, falling from $3 billion in the last week of April to just $228 million this week.
Historically, a slowdown in ETF inflows has impacted BTC price, notably when daily inflows averaged over $1.5 billion for consecutive weeks. To understand the potential impact on Bitcoin, let‚Äôs examine four key periods of significant spot ETF activity and their correlation with BTC pri‚Ä¶
articles.title: Spot Bitcoin ETF inflows fall, but BTC whale activity points to bull market acceleration

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Jennifer Dodgson
articles.description:
Opinion by: Jennifer Dodgson, co-founder of KIP Protocol and Eigenform AI
The puppet show is ending.
The Brookings Institution found that generative artificial intelligence may disrupt at least 50% of tasks performed by more than 30% of all workers. The same study also estimates that genAI may affect at least 10% of tasks performed by approximately 85% of the human workforce. The TL;DR from these stats? AI‚Äôs effects are likely to be both broad and deep.
If AI doesn‚Äôt already scare you, self-learning AI agents that autonomously achieve goals may fix that. Forget your sanitized ChatGPT conversations and bland AI assistants. Superior agents are AI that autonomously achieve human-set objectives by any means necessary. While OpenAI‚Äôs valuation of $300 billion benefits the few rather than the ma‚Ä¶
articles.title: The AI revolution won‚Äôt be centralized ‚Äî Superior agents are coming for Big Tech‚Äôs crown

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Onkar Singh
articles.description:
Understanding the 10-year Treasury yield: Definition and  importance            
            
                
The 10-year Treasury yield is the interest rate that the US government pays to borrow money for 10 years.
When the government needs cash, it issues bonds called Treasury notes, and the 10-year note is one of the most watched. The ‚Äúyield‚Äù is the annual return you‚Äôd get if you bought that bond and held it until it matures. It‚Äôs expressed as a percentage, like 4% or 5%.
Think of it as the government saying, ‚ÄúHey, lend me $1,000, and I‚Äôll pay you back in 10 years with some interest.‚Äù That interest rate and the yield move up or down based on demand for the bonds, inflation expectations and the overall economy. Because US Treasurys are considered safe (the government isn‚Äôt likely to def‚Ä¶
articles.title: What the 10-year Treasury yield means for crypto yields and stablecoins

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Zoltan Vardai
articles.description:
Wintermute, a London-based algorithmic crypto trading and market-making firm, has opened an office in New York as part of its expansion into the US.
Wintermute announced the opening of its New York office on May 15, citing improved regulatory conditions in the world‚Äôs largest economy.
‚ÄúAs the US takes a friendlier stance on digital assets and institutional adoption accelerates, we moved quickly to establish roots in New York City,‚Äù the company wrote in a May 15 X post, adding that the local presence will help them in ‚Äúcontributing to the future regulatory framework.‚Äù
Source: Wintermute
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre eager to continue our growth and play an integral role in the U.S. market,‚Äù according to Evgeny Gaevoy, CEO of Wintermute. ‚ÄúAs a neutral player with deep expertise in all areas of digital assets, we b‚Ä¶
articles.title: Wintermute opens New York office, citing improved US crypto rules

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Adrian Zmudzinski
articles.description:
Update (May 15 at 3:10 pm UTC): This article has been updated to include comments from Tether. 
A lag in Tether‚Äôs wallet blacklisting process allowed over $78 million in illicit funds to be moved before enforcement actions took effect, according to a new report from blockchain compliance company AMLBot.  
Tether‚Äôs address blacklisting becomes effective only after a considerable delay from when the process is initiated on Ethereum and Tron, according the report published May 15.
‚ÄúThis delay originates from Tether‚Äôs multisignature contract setup on both Tron and Ethereum, transforming what should be an immediate compliance action into a window of opportunity for illicit actors,‚Äú the report reads.
Tether‚Äôs blacklisting procedure is a multi-step process with a first transaction effectively war‚Ä¶
articles.title: Tether blacklist delay allowed $78M in illicit USDT transfers: Report

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Kyrian Alex
articles.description:
After the 2024 halving, Bitcoin mining entered its fifth epoch and block rewards were reduced from 6.25 BTC to 3.125 BTC. This forced miners to rethink their operations, optimize efficiency, cut energy costs and upgrade hardware to remain profitable. Cointelegraph Research, with insights from industry experts at Uminers, examines this transformation in its latest report. The analysis covers ASIC efficiency improvements, corporate performance, geographical expansion and new revenue models. As miners adapt, Bitcoin moves into a new era where institutional momentum and sovereign adoption could redefine its role in the global financial system.
Download the full report to uncover how miners are navigating this shift and what the future holds for Bitcoin‚Äôs mining industry.
The mining industry‚Äôs ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin mining 2025: Post-halving profitability, hashrate and energy trends
